items.sentence: I want Tom to know why I couldn\'t come to visit him today.
Tom wishes that he didn\'t have to help with the housework.
We\'ll eventually find a solution to this problem, I think.
I\'m not sure why they were forced to close the restaurant.
Tom told me that I should spend more time with my children.
Tom took one of the shirts out of the closet and put it on.
Tom and Mary were both very skinny when they were children.
Tom bought a computer at thirty percent off the list price.
Tom promised to meet me last night, but he never showed up.
I hear that Tom now works at the same company as Mary does.
We haven\'t yet been informed of the committee\'s decision.
Tom couldn\'t unlock the door because he had the wrong key.
Everyone needs someone to turn to when they\'re in trouble.
I couldn\'t leave you alone to face the danger by yourself.
Tom wouldn\'t like it if he knew Mary and John were dating.
Tom yelled something in French that I couldn\'t understand.
We rose from our seats when the national anthem was played.
When Tom was a kid, the only book in the house was a Bible.
Do you think we\'ll ever find our way back to the campsite?
When I was a kid, I often went to the beach to go swimming.
